name: reauthorize
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to give new official permission for something to happen, or to give someone official permission to do something again: They introduced a bill early last year to reauthorize grants to help low-income families. Legislation to re-authorise the program will be considered next year.
More examplesFewer examplesOpposition politicians want to see the law reauthorized.The change is temporary and needs to be reauthorised annually.The government are coming under pressure to re-authorise funding at existing levels.
